N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 43.1 - Superior Courts for Drug Treatment

State Regulations
(a) A Superior Court for Drug Treatment
may be established in Supreme Court or county court in any county by order of
the Chief Administrator of the Courts following consultation with and agreement
of the Presiding Justice of the Judicial Department in which such county is
located. A Superior Court for Drug Treatment shall have as its purpose the
hearing and determination of criminal cases in the courts of the county that
are appropriate for disposition by a drug treatment court. (b) The Chief Administrator, upon consultation with the Administrative Board of the Courts, shall promulgate
such rules as are necessary to regulate operation of each Superior Court for

Drug Treatment, and to permit transfer to the court, for disposition, of drug
cases that are pending in another court in the same county. Notes
